topic.title: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Release Notes for HP Helion Development Platform 1.2

body.p: The following release notes are for the HP Helion Development Platform 1.2 released in May 2015. We hope you enjoy the release!

section.title: Release Notes
section.p: The following features have been changed in the HP Helion Development Platform:

p.b: Develop, deploy, and manage cloud-native .NET applications

section.p: HP is the only vendor to offer this functionality in today's Cloud Foundry technology v2, which is a key part of HP Helion Development Platform. We offer Windows support by providing the ability to host Windows applications on a Windows DEA (Droplet Execution Agent) with a "bring your own Windows license" model.

p.b: Microsoft SQL Server integration available as an application service

section.p: Developers can bind their applications to a Microsoft SQL Server database via the service model and enable self-service dispensing of database resources - eliminating the need for administrative or operator intervention.

p.b: Complete set of .NET development tools and SDKs

section.p: The addition of the Visual Studio Cloud Foundry Explorer and MS Build tasks enable the .NET enterprise developer to deploy and manage their application directly from the favorite development IDE, command line environment or build agent.

Horizon panel updates for IT operations Administrators can now run even more operations from the HP Helion Openstack Horizon management console, including renaming clusters, adding DEA nodes, adding roles, proxy support and DNS suffixes.

section.title: Known Issues

p.b: When creating a new database, cf-mgmt create cluster or add-service command fails.

section.p: This issue applies to HP Helion Public Cloud only. When using cf-mgmt create cluster or add-service commands to create a new database, the operation fails. There is no workaround at this time.

p.b: Windows(R) DEA and SQL Server services are not available through the ALS Management Console

section.p: Although it appears that you can complete these tasks using the ALS Management Console, you must use the cf-mgmt tool or the Horizon console to add Windows(R) DEA Nodes and SQL Server services.

p.b: Windows Nodes do not support Linux services

section.p: Linux services -- for example, redis or mySQL -- can not be added to Windows(R) nodes.
